name: Putting On/Taking Off Footwear
description: The ability to put on & take off socks & shoes or other footwear that are appropriate for safe mobility.
exceptions: Not about the ability to put on & remove compression/anti-embolism stockings
tips: Consider the most usual performance, not the lowest
If patient needs help getting compression/anti-embolism stockings on, but is independent w/everything else in the item, the maximum score will be a '5'
dependent: The patient may be able to raise legs/feet to allow helper to put the shoes/socks on, but helper does all the effort to put on/remove socks & shoes or other footwear & patient contributes no effort to the task.
substantial: Patient participates in putting on/taking off shoes/footwear, but helper provides >50% of the effort
Patient is able to bring sock or shoe to the foot, but is unable to pull them on & snugly fit them on foot.
Once helper starts sock, patient is able to pull it on, but patient is unable to assist w/shoes/footwear
Patient is unable to assist w/socks, but once helper fits shoe/footwear on distal part of foot, patient is able to slip the entire foot into shoe/footwear
partial: Patient participates in putting on/taking off shoes/footwear, & helper provides <50% of the effort
Patient is able to pull on sock or shoe, but is unable to completely pull them on to fit snugly on foot w/or w/o adaptive equipment if necessary.

Once helper starts sock, patient is able to pull it on & once helper fits shoe/footwear on distal part of foot, patient is able to slip the entire foot into the shoe/footwear w/or w/o adaptive equipment if necessary.
supervision: The patient requires prompting & cueing for sequencing to fully accomplish putting on & taking off socks, shoes, or other footwear w/or w/o adaptive equipment.
There may be concerns about safety w/completing task w/o falling over which require verbal cues from helper for technique
Touching/Steadying only may be required while reaching forward to put on or take off shoes/socks or in fastening Velcro or tying shoe laces or in using adaptive equipment safely & correctly
setup: Patient needs helper for initial preparation such as handing patient socks/shoes or handing patient required equipment such as sock aid, shoe horn or in application of an orthosis/prosthesis/compression stockings. Patient may need helper to smooth stockings, or tie shoelaces or fasten velcro once shoes/footwear are on
Note: If a patient can complete all tasks of putting on/taking off footwear except putting on/taking off compression stockings, the score would be a '5'
independent: Patient puts on socks, shoes or other footwear (including compression stockings) & can tie/velcro the footwear as well as remove the footwear & socks/stockings w/o helper assistance. Patient can use required equipment such as sock aid or shoe horn.
